file_content.text: Glad to see you're still alive. You've been out there awhile.
Really didn't wanna come back empty-handed, did you?
Calling it quits? No shame in bowing out after a good run.
They don't call it quitting after you cross the finish line.
Read 'em and weep. I've won.
Maybe for a second rate like you. I finish the jobs I take.
Yeah there is, loser.
I've got your body, Bloodworthy. Bioscan incoming.
The traitor's dead.
Jicoln Cadera's sitting in my cargo hold on carbonite freeze. Transmitting vitals.
I've got the target on ice.
These scans match the data I have on file.
You actually caught him? Haha! How do you like that?
Would have been a shame if old age turned out to be the only match for Jicoln Cadera. Transferring your jackpot now.
Impressive work. Records indicate you are the twenty-eighth hunter to place a stake on that bounty. Twelfth to return.
Don't looks so proud of yourself. You bagged somebody's grandpa. Your lucky streak won't last.
Are we done, Bloodworthy?
If that's all...?
Care to put your money where your mouth is?
Wanna bet?
Sweetheart, I don't have to.
Look who's cocky now that he's sitting on a few credits.
Keep telling yourself that.
I wouldn't get your hopes up.
Don't have to.
All right, Jewl'a, we've all got better things to do than talk trash.
I'll make arrangements for the Mandalorians to take Jicoln off your hands. Expect a shuttle shortly. We'll be in touch.
Your target is Jicoln Cadera, a Mandalorian who's been in exile on Taris for ages now.
Word is he's been dead for a long time, but don't be taken in. Jicoln's still alive, and he's still very dangerous.
How's Jicoln managed to evade capture this long?
What makes him so dangerous?
He's resourceful and knows his environment better than anyone. All of Taris is his weapon.
How did a Mandalorian end up on the Blacklist?
What'd he do to deserve exile?
Cadera... I've met a Mandalorian by that name before. Any chance it's a relation?
I've heard that name before.
I don't track Mandalorian family trees, but I doubt anyone affiliated with Jicoln would be alive.
If he's human, he sounds old enough to be my grandfather.
This guy's gotta be ancient.
Not quite, but he may be a little older than Mandalore if I remember correctly. This all started between the two of them.
Jicoln refused the call of Mandalore--unforgivable on its own, but Jicoln did one better. He rallied an army against him.
Jicoln's forces were routed, and he ultimately fled to Taris. Where he's been since.
If Mandalore knew where Jicoln went, why didn't he finish him off?
Mandalore just left him here?
He tried, but Jicoln proved to be a better survivor than he was a general.
Any idea why Jicoln would want to oppose Mandalore? Jealousy?
You know what started this?
No idea. It's a touchy subject, and I'm not interested enough to risk asking. I do know that Mandalore was serious about killing him.
I'm supposed to be afraid of this screwup?
He doesn't sound too bright.
If you're smart, you'll at least take him seriously. On Taris, he's king.
It took a year of searching and a great many dead before Mandalore finally washed his hands of the traitor and left him in exile.
Ever since then, Grand Champions have attempted to win the glory of taking Jicoln's head.
Has there been any word of Jicoln recently?
You have any leads?
No, and I doubt there will be. This Blacklist mark has evaded some two dozen hunters over the years.
Good thing I never "attempt" anything.
Consider it done.
You expect me to slog around an entire planet looking for one washed-up hermit?
This is pointless.
I guess you do what you have to do.
Friendly word of advice: If you're going to pick up the trail before the Empire wipes it out, you're going to need more than your own two eyes.
There's a Mandalorian base camp on the ground. I'd speak with the ranking officer there.
Get my credits together, Bloodworthy. Next time we talk, I'll have your traitor.
I'll try to make this quick.
Will do.
Looks like break time's over.
You finally scrape together some credits? Good, I was getting bored.
Change your mind about putting a stake in this bounty?
I'm ready to chance it. Fill me in.
Yes.
Forgot how much I needed, looks like I can't cover it.
Yeah, but I'm still short. [Refuse Quest]
Thought I'd see if you're done jerking me around.
Just wondering if you'd cave. [Refuse Quest]
No free rides--and I'm not spotting you the entry.
Call me when you're serious about this.
Hello, hunter. Fancy seeing you here. Relax, this isn't a prank.
This bounty is more of a Blacklist tradition than an actual contract. It's been passed from hunter to hunter for over a decade.
I was the last hunter to take the contract who's still breathing, so I'm the one passing the torch.
I just need the who and where.
Give me the details.
Now that information's going to cost you.
Sounds like you botched the job.
Target too tough for you?
I failed, like every other hunter. Don't think you'll be any different.
Keep your torch, what's this tradition pay?
I hunt for credits, not sport.
Like I said, it's not actually a bounty. More of a friendly wager.
See, every hunter to take the contract puts up an ante. The one who actually bags the target claims the stakes.
Nobody expected things to carry on this long, so the payout's grown over the years. The ante is listed on the job.
All right, credits are being transferred.
I'll ante in.
That's it. Not going to bankrupt you, but odds are it's credits you're never going to see again.
I'm a little strapped for cash right now.
I can't afford it. [Refuse Quest]
Not many hunters make it to retirement, but most of us still save up a few credits.
Call me when you're off your vacation and working again.
I'm not paying you to take a bounty.
No deal. [Refuse Quest]
Those are the rules, you don't have to like them. Call me when you're not too scared to take a risk.
Quite a haul. I've got a good idea how you can start spending it, but that can wait.
You bagged somebody's grandpa. Your lucky streak'll end on Hoth.
